Derailment & PA - RAM - MEWP derailed at Sandown Pway sidings causing bruising and cuts to the hands and chest of the operator

Operating Incident, 22/09/2020, An RRV cherry picker being used in connection with engineering work on the Island Line became derailed at Sandown siding approximately 40 metres from where it had been placed on the rails. The operator had sustained an injury to their arm. Initial investigations indicated a possible issue with the RRV because one of the front wheels was 2 inches of the rail. The fitter reported that everything was working fine with self-levelling of the wheels, but it could be seen that when the machine was heading back to "off track" the wheel still wasn’t touching the rail and got stuck and couldn’t move. Even when the machine was stable and ready to "off track", the wheel was not touching the rail by 20mm. If the self-levelling part of the machine was working, the wheel that was in the air should have been touching the head of the rail. There was no damage to any off the track because it only travelled about 30 to 50 meters.

Belated report of a personal injury received by the SAM at Immingham believed to have happened circa 14:00 Monday 29/04. A contractor employed by LCM was working on a tank wagon on the tank testing line when a manlid on the wagon struck one of his legs. The contractor was taken to A&E and required stitches. The contractors, LCM were working on behalf of Motorail who inturn were working for VTG.

Belated advice of Personal Injury to Cambridgeshire driver via their SDM. Walking back from the station,  after working 4M82, was approximately 100 yards from my car when I felt something "pop" in my left knee , that immediately resulted in pain and a difficulty in walking. There was no defect in the path / walking area and there was no slip, trip or fall. I believe it was just a random event that could of occurred at any time. As a result of this incident I felt in prudent to call in sick sooner rather than later, as to avoid a cancellation of a service.

Copied from XXXXXXX XXXXX statement email: my name is XXXXXXX XXXXX  (Track Team). I am not coming in tonight as I had a accident last night at WBP. My job was to scope the whole WBP area for ballast work with my principal XXXXXXX. Because of rain we cancelled our job as we couldn't see the dusty ballast for voids. As it was raining then we decided to help XXXX XXXXXX and XXXXXX with their BVI-24, loose and missing clips and removal of lane 6 signs from WB. After finishing all the jobs, myself and XXXX picked up the signs from turnback A and started walking back to ROP. On the way back I saw few lids were off from the troffins next to turnback A and decided to put them back on for everyone's safety. XXXXXXX and I made them safe. As XXXXX(ODM) as Lookout and XXX (COSS) witness this as they were walking behind us. Then I picked up the sign and started walking again and few metres away, my left foot went through another troffin which looked visibly fine to walk over while carrying the sign which was little heavy. When I fell down and my left knee landed on the ballast. On that moment it was sore and I had bleeding. We walked back and cleared the work site. We returned to Plumstead and after finishing my shift when I went home and took my PPE off then I saw my PPE was covered with blood and by then it was painful. I bandaged it, took few pain killers, and went to sleep. When I woke up my knee was stiff and painful as it is internal injury. So, I will be resting my knee. Can you please put this in the accident book for me and forward me the copy as well. I have informed my seniors as well. Thanks.
